title: How hard is it to become a financial advisor? - Quora

response.answer_text: How hard is it to become a basketball player? All you need are some shoes, a basketball, and a hoop. How hard is it to become a professional basketball player? HARD. It takes years of practice, dedication, and consistency in your work to become a true professional. It's actually really easy to become a financial advisor. Take a weekend class, pass an insurance test, pay a few bucks and BOOM.. You're a financial advisor. Becoming a lasting, quality financial advisor takes dedication, hard work, and a commitment to the industry. Getting people to trust your work, judgement, and advice is difficult - and keeping that trust is even harder. The financial advisory profession is looked at as a bunch of slick salespeople, but a true professional cares more about the clients and the industry that their pocketbook.

No, it’s very easy. There is no law against declaring yourself a financial advisor, consultant, etc. All you need is a suit and a sales pitch. The world is filled with so called finanical advisors, consultants, etc. selling insurance, annuities, etc. If you are serious about becoming a financial advisor, there are several very good certifications such as Certified Financial Planner and Chartered Financial Analyst. Attaining them is not easy but it will give you a good knowledge base and credibility.
